alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 1:51PM CST until February 22 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Mill Creek Near Nolensville affecting Davidson County. For the Mill Creek...including Nolensville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Mill Creek Near Nolensville. * WHEN...This afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water begins to inundate low lying areas along the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 11.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 400 PM CST.
